question: Are the internal and external sources currently providing data?
Has a background check or due diligence been conducted on the provider?
Is the data format compatible with our systems (CSV, JSON, APIs, etc.)?
Has the data been tested for consistency and reliability over time?
Are data usage rights, licensing terms, and restrictions clearly defined?
Does the provider offer industry-specific or domain-specific datasets?
Is there flexibility or tiered pricing based on data usage or user volume?
Is the license for single-use, multi-use, or enterprise-wide access?
Does the vendor provide 24/7 support or only during business hours?
Does the SLA include provisions for data accuracy and freshness?
Has a structured RFP or RFI process been conducted for transparency?
Are there any restrictions on sharing the data across departments or regions?
Are we purchasing the data outright or licensing it?
Has the need been validated by business/data stakeholders?
Is technical support available post-acquisition?
Is there a defined ROI or value metric associated with acquiring this data?
Are we purchasing the data outright or licensing it?
Has the need been validated by business/data stakeholders?
Is technical support available post-acquisition?
Is the vendor responsive and timely in resolving issues?
Does the renewal offer better terms, pricing, or expanded access?
Are there opportunities to renegotiate based on actual usage or performance?
Has the data become obsolete, redundant, or replaced by better sources?
